body.quiz: If someone says this greeting to you, what would you say?
body.incorrect: Not quite… would you like to try again?

body.quiz: Around which of the following times should you use this phrase for a greeting?
body.correct: Terrific! 下午好 xiàwǔhǎo – “afternoon” + “good.” It’s the perfect greeting for 3 p.m.
body.incorrect: Almost… would you like to try again?

body.quiz: What is the correct word order in this greeting phrase?
body.correct: Outstanding work! 晚上好 wǎnshànghǎo – “evening” + “good.” How nice it is to snuggle with family in an early evening to watch a fun movie!
body.incorrect: Oops… would you like to try again?

body.quiz: Which of the following phrases would the phrase presented go best with?
options: It’s great running into you before our last class period.
body.correct: You nailed it! We say 晚安 wǎn‘ān – “evening” + “peaceful.” 安 ān is an auspicious word in Chinese culture. Many people name their children using 安 ān; for example, 李安 Lǐ Ān (Ang Lee), the director of the movie, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon.
body.incorrect: Not quite… would you like to try again?
